pr_title: Prevent deploying IPv6 network if Zone has no IPv6 DNS configured

timeline.message:
Deploy ipv6 network if zone has IPv6 DNS

If you have a IPv6 enabled network and you haven't specified the IPv6 DNS 1 and DNS 2 under the zone it causes dnsmasq inside the Virtual Router not to start

timeline.bodyText:
CloudStack uses SLAAC for managing IPv6 ranges, therefore it is not necessary to have a start/end IPv6 address; on the other hand, IPv6 CIDR is mandatory for IPv6 networks.
That is why I changed this and other pieces of code that had start/end ipv6 address as mandatory.
timeline.author: GabrielBrascher

timeline.bodyText: Due to SLAAC implementation, an IPv6 network needs CIDR and Gateway. With the refactored code a network is "marked" as ipv6 if IPv6 CIDR and Gateway are not null.
timeline.author: GabrielBrascher

timeline.bodyText: Nowadays IPv6 networking support only /64 CIDR. Added Unit tests covering this.
